title: Understanding Systematic Errors
text: Systematic errors are consistent and repeatable errors that occur due to a flaw in the measurement system. They can often be identified and corrected.

title: Identifying the Source of Error
text: Consider whether the error is due to a consistent issue with the equipment or method used. If it is, it is likely a systematic error.

title: Classifying the Error Type
text: Which type of error is consistent and predictable, often due to faulty equipment?
